result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

02:07 PM Defendant Florentino Hernandez Rodriguez in court with attorney Travis A. Crowell.  Interpreter in court. Edward Daniel Burke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rachael Race/VWC in court. Court makes stmt. Interpreter sworn. State calls Darren Laskowski/Chief Deputy who is sworn and testified. Cross exam by Atty Crowell. Witness excused. No other evidence offered. Court finds probable cause a felony has been committed and defendant is bound over to circuit court. Present bond cont'd.  Arraignment scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Confirmation from ITGB re certified spanish interpreter needed for 3/31/2022 hrg

09:33 AM Defendant Florentino Hernandez Rodriguez in court with attorney Travis A. Crowell.  Edward Daniel Burke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter in court. Rachael Race/VWC in court.  Interpreter sworn in. Victim rights. Defendant is aware of the charges and possible penalities, waives reading of criminal complaint and request PH within time limits. Present bond cont'd.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
